sentences.en: Near to the banks of the Cephissus lived the giant Procrustes , of whom (as was the case with other giants) Theseus had heard long before he met him.
sentences.cn: 在科菲索斯河岸边住着巨人普洛克洛斯忒斯，就象其它的巨人一样，忒修斯早就听说了他的情况。

sentences.en: Procrustes was accustomed to invite strangers to spend a night in his cave, and if the guest were tall he would lead him to the shorter bed.
sentences.cn: 普洛克洛斯忒斯总是请陌生人到山洞中过夜，如果客人很高，他就把他领到较短的床上。

sentences.en: Some school teachers wish to stretch all children on the bad of Procrustes.
sentences.cn: 有些小学老师主张对所有的孩子提出同样的要求.

trans.tran_cn: 普罗克拉斯提斯（古希腊神话传说中 Attica 的一个强盗）
trans.tran_en: a robber, who put travellers in his bed, stretching or lopping off their limbs so that they fitted it
